001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.util.FastMath;
004
005/**
006 * Performs spline interpolation given a set of control points. This class is
007 * here because it needs to be serializable which the default apache version is
008 * not. Oh and also I needed one that did monotonic interpolation for CDFs.
009 *
010 * <p>
011 * Interpolation is clamped to the domain of the input data. The spline is
012 * guaranteed to pass through each control point exactly. Optionally the spline
013 * can be constrained to be monotonic.
014 */
015public class SplineInterpolator implements Interpolator {
016
017        /**
018         * Creates a cubic spline from a given set of control points.
019         *
020         * @param x The X component of the control points in increasing order
021         * @param y The Y component of the control points
022         * @see #createCubicSpline(double[], double[], boolean)
023         * @return A cubic spline interpolator that passes through the given control
024         *         points
025         */
026        public static SplineInterpolator createCubicSpline(double[] x, double[] y) {
027                return createCubicSpline(x, y, false);
028        }
029
030        /**
031         * Creates a (possibily monotonic) cubic spline from a given set of control
032         * points.
033         *
034         * The spline is guaranteed to pass through each control point exactly.
035         * Moreover, assuming the control points are monotonic (Y is non-decreasing
036         * or non-increasing) then the interpolated values will also be monotonic.
037         * Interpolation is clamped to the domain of the input data.
038         *
039         * This function uses finite differences for non monotonic and the
040         * Fritsch-Carlson method for monotonic for computing the spline parameters.
041         * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monotone_cubic_interpolation
042         *
043         * @param x         The X component of the control points in increasing order
044         * @param y         The Y component of the control points
045         * @param monotonic Constrain spline to be monotonic (y must be increasing or
046         *                  decreasing order)
047         * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the X or Y arrays are null, have
048         *                                  different lengths or have fewer than 2
049         *                                  values.
050         * @return A cubic spline interpolator that passes through the given control
051         */
052        public static SplineInterpolator createCubicSpline(
053                        double[] x, double[] y, boolean monotonic
054        ) {
055                Interpolator.checkInputs(x, y);
056                final var n = x.length;
057                var d = new double[n - 1]; // could optimize this out
058                var m = new double[n];
059
060                // Compute slopes of secant lines between successive points.
061                for (var i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
062
063                        if (!Double.isFinite(x[i]) || !Double.isFinite(y[i])) {
064                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
065                                                "Non-finite values in Spline Interpolator"
066                                );
067                        }
068
069                        var h = x[i + 1] - x[i];
070                        if (h <= 0.0) {
071                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
072                                                "The control points must all "
073                                                                + "have strictly increasing X values."
074                                );
075                        }
076                        d[i] = (y[i + 1] - y[i]) / h;
077                }
078
079                // Initialize the tangents as the average of the secants.
080                m[0] = d[0];
081                for (var i = 1; i < n - 1; i++) {
082                        m[i] = (d[i - 1] + d[i]) * 0.5;
083                }
084                m[n - 1] = d[n - 2];
085
086                if (monotonic) {
087                        // Update the tangents to preserve monotonicity.
088                        for (var i = 0; i < n - 1; i++) {
089                                if (d[i] == 0.0) { // successive Y values are equal
090                                        m[i] = 0.0;
091                                        m[i + 1] = 0.0;
092                                } else {
093                                        var a = m[i] / d[i];
094                                        var b = m[i + 1] / d[i];
095                                        var h = FastMath.hypot(a, b);
096                                        // Math hypot gives sqrt hence 3 and not 9 as in wikipedia:
097                                        if (h > 3.0) {
098                                                var t = 3.0 / h;
099                                                m[i] = t * a * d[i];
100                                                m[i + 1] = t * b * d[i];
101                                        }
102                                }
103                        }
104                }
105                return new SplineInterpolator(x, y, m);
106        }
107
108        /**
109         * Creates a monotonic cubic spline from a given set of control points.
110         *
111         * @param x The X component of the control points in increasing order
112         * @param y The Y component of the control points in increasing or decreasing
113         *          order
114         * @see #createCubicSpline(double[], double[], boolean)
115         * @return A monotonic cubic spline interpolator that passes through the
116         *         given control points
117         */
118        public static SplineInterpolator createMonotoneCubicSpline(
119                        double[] x, double[] y
120        ) {
121                return createCubicSpline(x, y, true);
122        }
123
124        private final double[] mX;
125
126        private final double[] mY;
127
128        private final double[] mM;
129
130        private SplineInterpolator(double[] x, double[] y, double[] m) {
131                this.mX = x;
132                this.mY = y;
133                this.mM = m;
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Interpolates the value of Y = f(X) for given X. Clamps X to the domain of
138         * the spline.
139         *
140         * @param x The X value.
141         * @return The interpolated Y = f(X) value.
142         */
143        @Override
144        public double differential(double x) {
145                // Handle the boundary cases.
146                final var n = this.mX.length;
147                if (Double.isNaN(x)) { return x; }
148                if ((x <= this.mX[0]) || (x >= this.mX[n - 1])) {
149                        return 0; // mM[n - 1];
150                }
151
152                // Find the index 'i' of the last point with smaller X.
153                // We know this will be within the spline due to the boundary tests.
154                var i = 0;
155                while (x >= this.mX[i + 1]) {
156                        i += 1;
157                        if (x == this.mX[i]) { return this.mM[i]; }
158                }
159
160                var p0 = this.mY[i];
161                var m0 = this.mM[i];
162                var p1 = this.mY[i + 1];
163                var m1 = this.mM[i + 1];
164
165                // Perform cubic Hermite spline interpolation.
166                var scale = this.mX[i + 1] - this.mX[i];
167                var t = (x - this.mX[i]) / scale;
168                var t2 = t * t;
169                var h00 = 6 * t2 - 6 * t;
170                var h10 = 3 * t2 - 4 * t + 1;
171                var h01 = -6 * t2 + 6 * t;
172                var h11 = 3 * t2 - 2 * t;
173
174                // https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/2444650/cubic-hermite-spline-derivative
175                // and
176                // https://github.com/thibauts/cubic-hermite-spline/blob/master/index.js
177                // Correct scaling:
178                // https://github.com/liuyxpp/CubicHermiteSpline.jl/blob/master/src/univariate.jl
179
180                return (h00 * p0 + h10 * m0 * scale + h01 * p1 + h11 * m1 * scale)
181                                / scale;
182        }
183
184        /**
185         * Generates an inverse spline that approximates the inverse function of this
186         * spline. The generated spline will have the same number of control points
187         * as this spline, but with the X and Y components swapped. The generated
188         * spline will be monotonic if this spline is monotonic.
189         *
190         * @return A new SplineInterpolator that approximates the inverse function of
191         *         this spline.
192         */
193        public SplineInterpolator generateInverse() {
194                // return createMonotoneCubicSpline(mY,mX);
195
196                var intervals = (this.mY.length) - (this.mY.length) % 2; // ensure even
197                var yMin = this.mY[0];
198                var yMax = this.mY[this.mY.length - 1];
199                var y = new double[intervals + 1];
200                var x = new double[intervals + 1];
201                x[0] = this.mX[0];
202                x[intervals] = this.mX[this.mX.length - 1];
203                y[0] = this.mY[0];
204                y[intervals] = this.mY[this.mY.length - 1];
205                var step = (yMax - yMin) / (intervals);
206                for (var i = 1; i < intervals; i++) {
207                        y[i] = yMin + i * step;
208                        x[i] = this.inverse(y[i]);
209                }
210                return createMonotoneCubicSpline(y, x);
211        }
212
213        private double initialGuess(double y) {
214                // Binary search to find interval [mY[i], mY[i+1]] containing y
215                var i = 0;
216                var j = this.mY.length - 1;
217
218                if (y <= this.mY[0]) { return this.mX[0]; }
219                if (y >= this.mY[j]) { return this.mX[j]; }
220
221                while (i < j - 1) {
222                        var mid = (i + j) / 2;
223                        if (y < this.mY[mid]) {
224                                j = mid;
225                        } else {
226                                i = mid;
227                        }
228                }
229
230                // Linear interpolation in y → x
231                var t = (y - this.mY[i]) / (this.mY[i + 1] - this.mY[i]);
232                return this.mX[i] + t * (this.mX[i + 1] - this.mX[i]);
233        }
234
235        /**
236         * Interpolates the value of Y = f(X) for given X. Clamps X to the domain of
237         * the input data.
238         *
239         * @param x The X value.
240         * @return The interpolated Y = f(X) value.
241         */
242        @Override
243        public double interpolate(double x) {
244                // Handle the boundary cases.
245                final var n = this.mX.length;
246                if (Double.isNaN(x)) { return x; }
247                if (x <= this.mX[0]) { return this.mY[0]; }
248                if (x >= this.mX[n - 1]) { return this.mY[n - 1]; }
249
250                // Find the index 'i' of the last point with smaller X.
251                // We know this will be within the spline due to the boundary tests.
252                var i = 0;
253                while (x >= this.mX[i + 1]) {
254                        i += 1;
255                        if (x == this.mX[i]) { return this.mY[i]; }
256                }
257
258                // Perform cubic Hermite spline interpolation.
259                var p0 = this.mY[i];
260                var m0 = this.mM[i];
261                var p1 = this.mY[i + 1];
262                var m1 = this.mM[i + 1];
263
264                var scale = this.mX[i + 1] - this.mX[i];
265                var t = (x - this.mX[i]) / scale;
266
267                var t2 = t * t;
268                var it = 1 - t;
269                var it2 = it * it;
270                var tt = 2 * t;
271                var h00 = (1 + tt) * it2;
272                var h10 = t * it2;
273                var h01 = t2 * (3 - tt);
274                var h11 = t2 * (t - 1);
275
276                return h00 * p0 + h10 * m0 * scale + h01 * p1 + h11 * m1 * scale;
277
278//              return (p0 * (1 + 2 * t) + scale * m0 * t) * (1 - t) * (1 - t)
279//                              + (p1 * (3 - 2 * t) + scale * m1 * (t - 1)) * t * t;
280
281        }
282
283        /**
284         * Computes the inverse of this spline at a given Y value. This method uses
285         * the Newton-Raphson method to find the X value such that interpolate(X) ≈
286         * Y. The method is robust to non-monotonic splines and handles edge cases
287         * gracefully.
288         *
289         * @param y The Y value for which to compute the inverse.
290         * @return The X value such that interpolate(X) ≈ Y.
291         */
292        public double inverse(double y) {
293                // Handle boundaries
294                if (y <= this.mY[0]) { return this.mX[0]; }
295                if (y >= this.mY[this.mY.length - 1]) {
296                        return this.mX[this.mX.length - 1];
297                }
298
299                // Initial guess: interpolate in (y, x) space using the control points
300                var init = this.initialGuess(y);
301                var x = init;
302
303                final var maxIter = 8; // Low limit for speed
304                final var tol = 1e-6; // Reduced accuracy tolerance
305                final var eps = 1e-12;
306
307                for (var i = 0; i < maxIter; i++) {
308                        var fx = this.interpolate(x);
309                        var dfx = this.differential(x);
310
311                        var delta = (fx - y);
312                        if (FastMath.abs(delta) < tol) { return x; }
313
314                        if (FastMath.abs(dfx) < eps) {
315                                // Derivative near zero — avoid division by zero
316                                break;
317                        }
318
319                        var step = delta / dfx;
320                        var xNew = x - step;
321
322                        // If step is huge or NaN, fall back to secant guess
323                        if (Double.isNaN(xNew) || FastMath.abs(step) > 1e6) { break; }
324
325                        // Clamp to domain
326                        if (xNew <= this.mX[0]) {
327                                x = this.mX[0] + 1e-8;
328                        } else if (xNew >= this.mX[this.mX.length - 1]) {
329                                x = this.mX[this.mX.length - 1] - 1e-8;
330                        } else {
331                                x = xNew;
332                        }
333                }
334
335                // If Newton fails, fall back to closest of initial and last estimate
336                return (FastMath.abs(init - y) > FastMath.abs(x - y)) ? x : init;
337        }
338
339        @Override
340        public String toString() {
341                var str = new StringBuilder();
342                final var n = this.mX.length;
343                str.append("[");
344                for (var i = 0; i < n; i++) {
345                        if (i != 0) { str.append(", "); }
346                        str.append("(").append(this.mX[i]);
347                        str.append(", ").append(this.mY[i]);
348                        str.append(": ").append(this.mM[i]).append(")");
349                }
350                str.append("]");
351                return str.toString();
352        }
353

385}
